name: Islamic Human Rights Commission
goal:
The objectives of the Islamic Human Rights Commission are:
1) To champion the rights and duties revealed for human beings
2) To promote a new social and international order based on truth, justice, righteousness & generosity rather than selfish interest.
3) To gather information and publicize atrocities, oppression, discrimination, and other abuses
4) To campaign for redress and support the victims of such crimes
5) To cooperate with other groups and individuals where such cooperation is likely to further the achievement of these aims.
Our mission is to campaign for justice for all peoples regardless of their racial, confessional and political background
interests: Audiovisual and Media, External Relations, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives:
FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS POLICY

Tackling Racism and Xenophobia

Set of legislative measures:

1) The Council Framework Decision (2008/913/JHA) (procedural number: 2001/0270/CNS ) of 28 November 2008 on Combating racism and Xenophobia

2) The Employment Equality Directive

3) Racial Equality Directive (2000/43/EC)

4) Proposal for Equal Treatment Directive (2008/0140(APP), combatting discrimination based on religion or belief, disability, age or sexual orientation and to put into effect the principle of equal treatment, outside the field of employment. (awaiting final decision)

5) The Audiovisual Media Services Directive- banning incitement to hatred in audiovisual media services

6) Code of Conduct on Countering Illegal Hate Speech Online
